listitem.para: #define _AFXDLL
#define CATCH_MFC_EX_S ;
#define CATCH_MFC_EX_E ;
#define API_LOCK_GUARD
#define API_UNLOCK
#define API_UNLOCK_RETURN_ERROR(success, error_message)
#define RETURN_ERROR(success, error_message)
#define GET_VALUE(key, default_val)
#define LOAD_VALUE(target, key, default_val)
#define GET_CONFIG_VALUE(key, default_val)
#define LOAD_CONFIG_VALUE(target, key, default_val)
using json = nlohmann::json
bool CLA_InitializeMFC (bool InitializeAfx, bool InitializeAfxSocket)
ERROR_CODE_TYPE AddErrorMessage (const std::string &error_message)
API_EXPORT bool CLA_FNDEF DidErrorOccur ()
Check if an error has occurred since the last call to GetLastError.
API_EXPORT const char *CLA_FNDEF GetLastError ()
returns the last error messages
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF Create (bool InitializeAfx, bool InitializeAfxSocket)

Initializes the ControlAPI. If you use a bare function C API, then this function must be called before using any other functions in the API. If you didn't load MFC yet (which is the case if you use Qt), then set.
API_EXPORT void CLA_FNDEF Cleanup ()
This function must be called when you are finished using the API. The class wrapped version of this API calls this function in its destructor.
API_EXPORT void CLA_FNDEF Configure (bool _DisplayErrors)
Configures if the ControlAPI should display error messages.
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF Initialize ()
After Configuring the hardware, e.g. by loading a json configuration file, this function must be called to initialize the hardware.
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF IsReady ()
Checks if the ControlAPI is ready to be used.
API_EXPORT void CLA_FNDEF SwitchDebugMode (bool OnOff, const char *FileName)

Switches Debug mode on. In Debug mode, the sequence of each FPGA sequencer is written to a human readable ASCII file before being sent to the FPGA. In addition, the FPGA sequencers display more information on their USB-UART port, being slowed down a bit by that.
API_EXPORT void CLA_FNDEF StartAssemblingSequence ()
Starts assembling a sequence. Clears any previous sequence. Must be called before adding commands to the sequence.
API_EXPORT void CLA_FNDEF ExecuteSequence ()
Executes the sequence that was previously assembled.
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF GetSequenceExecutionStatus (bool &running, unsigned long long &DataPointsWritten)
Get the current status of the sequence execution.
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF WaitTillEndOfSequenceThenGetInputData (uint8_t *&buffer, unsigned long &buffer_length, unsigned long &EndTimeOfCycle, double timeout_in_s)
Waits until the sequence is finished, then gets the input data from the FPGA sequencer.
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetTimeDebtGuard_in_ms (const double &MaxTimeDebt_in_ms)

Sets a guard time. If sequencer commands make the time advance more than the guard time beyond what's allowed by Wait_ms, an error will be recorded (check with DidErrorOccur() if that happened) or thrown.
CDeviceSequencer * GetSequencer (const unsigned int &Sequencer)
CDeviceSequencer * GetSequencerBeforeInitialization (const unsigned int &Sequencer)

API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SequencerStartAnalogInAcquisition (const unsigned int &Sequencer, const uint8_t &ChannelNumber, const uint32_t &NumberOfDataPoints, const double &DelayBetweenDataPoints_in_ms)

Start analog acquisition on the specified channel. This function places a commandto for the FPGA in the sequencer buffer. The analog in acquisition will start when this command is executed by the FPGA. Only one analog in acquisition can hapen at each moment. A new one can start right after the previous one is finished. The data will be returned at the end of a sequence when using CLA_WaitTillEndOfSequenceThenGetInputData.
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SequencerWriteInputMemory (const unsigned int &Sequencer, unsigned long input_buf_mem_data, bool write_next_address, unsigned long input_buf_mem_address)

Writes a value to the input memory of the sequencer. This is useful to mark the start or end of a data acquisition, or to mark the type of experimental run in the full fledged version of the ControlAPI, which can cycle sequences automatically in the background. To execute this function, a command for the FPGA must be placed in the sequencer buffer.
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SequencerWriteSystemTimeToInputMemory (const unsigned int &Sequencer)
Writes the current FPGA clock ticks to the input memory of the sequencer.
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SequencerSwitchDebugLED (const unsigned int &Sequencer, unsigned int OnOff)
Switches the debug LED of the FPGA on or off.
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SequencerIgnoreTCPIP (const unsigned int &Sequencer, bool OnOff)

Switches the sequencer to ignore TCP/IP commands. This is useful to prevent the sequencer from being interrupted by TCP/IP commands while executing a timing critical task, such as transferring input data from the FPGA BRAM to the DDR. This can be useful if lots of data is acquired at a high rate. Lot's of meaning: more than the size of the BRAM input buffer. How much that is depends how you configured the Vivado project that generates the FPGA sequencer firmware.
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SequencerAddMarker (const unsigned int &Sequencer, unsigned char marker)
Places a marker in the sequencer buffer. The FPGA SOM's CPU will see this marker and can react to it, e.g. write it to the USB-UART for debugging.

API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetRegister (const unsigned int &Sequencer, const unsigned int &Address, const unsigned int &SubAddress, const uint8_t *Data, const unsigned long &DataLength_in_bit, const uint8_t &StartBit)

This function sets a register for a device on the sequencer. What this means depends on the device type. This function gives us an easy way to add new functionality to a device without having to programm new DLL functions. SetRegister maps to the register map given in the device's datasheet. Note: this is not currently implemented in the API.

API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetValue (const unsigned int &Sequencer, const unsigned int &Address, const unsigned int &SubAddress, const uint8_t *Data, const unsigned long &DataLength_in_bit, const uint8_t &StartBit)

This function sets a value for a device on the sequencer. What this means depends on the device type. This function gives us an easy way to add new functionality to a device without having to programm new DLL functions. In contrast to SetRegister, SetValue can execute more complex operations, such as calculating a DDS frequency tuning word from the given frequency and then programming that. There can be several SetValue functions for the same SetRegister function. There can be SetValue functions that set some parameter, or that trigger some action, not even necessarily related to the registers of the device.

API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetValueSerialDevice (const unsigned int &Sequencer, const unsigned int &Address, const unsigned int &SubAddress, const uint8_t *Data, const unsigned long &DataLength_in_bit, const uint8_t &StartBit)
As SetValue, but for serial devices.

API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetRegisterSerialDevice (const unsigned int &Sequencer, const unsigned int &Address, const unsigned int &SubAddress, const uint8_t *Data, const unsigned long &DataLength_in_bit, const uint8_t &StartBit)
As SetRegister, but for serial devices.
CDevice * GetParallelBusDevice (const unsigned int &Sequencer, const unsigned int &Address)
CDevice * GetSerialBusDevice (const unsigned int &Sequencer, const unsigned int &Address)
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetVoltage (const unsigned int &Sequencer, const unsigned int &Address, double Voltage)
Sets the voltage of an analog output device.
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetDigitalOutput (const unsigned int &Sequencer, const unsigned int &Address, uint8_t BitNr, bool OnOff)
Sets a digital output to high or low.
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetStartFrequency (const unsigned int &Sequencer, const unsigned int &Address, double Frequency)
Sets the start frequency of a DDS (for now a AD9854 DDS).
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetStopFrequency (const unsigned int &Sequencer, const unsigned int &Address, double Frequency)
Sets the stop frequency of a DDS (for now a AD9854 DDS).
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetModulationFrequency (const unsigned int &Sequencer, const unsigned int &Address, double Frequency)
Sets the modulation frequency of a DDS (for now a AD9854 DDS).
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetPower (const unsigned int &Sequencer, const unsigned int &Address, double Power)
Sets the power of a DDS (for now a AD9854 DDS).
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetAttenuation (const unsigned int &Sequencer, const unsigned int &Address, double Attenuation)
Sets the attenuation of a DDS (for now a AD9854 DDS).
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetStartFrequencyTuningWord (const unsigned int &Sequencer, const unsigned int &Address, uint64_t FrequencyTuningWord)
Sets the start frequency tuning word of a DDS (for now a AD9854 DDS).
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetStopFrequencyTuningWord (const unsigned int &Sequencer, const unsigned int &Address, uint64_t FrequencyTuningWord)
Sets the stop frequency tuning word of a DDS (for now a AD9854 DDS).
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetFSKMode (const unsigned int &Sequencer, const unsigned int &Address, uint8_t mode)
Sets the FKS mode of a DDS (for now a AD9854 DDS).
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetRampRateClock (const unsigned int &Sequencer, const unsigned int &Address, uint8_t rate)
Sets the ramp rate clock of a DDS (for now a AD9854 DDS).
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetClearACC1 (const unsigned int &Sequencer, const unsigned int &Address, bool OnOff)
Clears the ACC1 bit of a DDS (for now a AD9854 DDS).
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetTriangleBit (const unsigned int &Sequencer, const unsigned int &Address, bool OnOff)
Sets the triangle bit of a DDS (for now a AD9854 DDS).
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetFSKBit (const unsigned int &Sequencer, const unsigned int &Address, bool OnOff)
Sets the FSK bit of a DDS (for now a AD9854 DDS).
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetFrequency (const unsigned int &Sequencer, const unsigned int &Address, double Frequency)
Sets the frequency of a DDS.
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetFrequencyTuningWord (const unsigned int &Sequencer, const unsigned int &Address, uint64_t FrequencyTuningWord)
Sets the frequency tuning word of a DDS.
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetFrequencyOfChannel (const unsigned int &Sequencer, const unsigned int &Address, uint8_t channel, double Frequency)
Sets the frequency of a multi channel DDS (for now the AD9958).
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetFrequencyTuningWordOfChannel (const unsigned int &Sequencer, const unsigned int &Address, uint8_t channel, uint64_t FrequencyTuningWord)
Sets the frequency tuning word of a multi channel DDS (for now the AD9958).
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetPhaseOfChannel (const unsigned int &Sequencer, const unsigned int &Address, uint8_t channel, double Phase)
Sets the phase of a multi channel DDS (for now the AD9958).
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetPowerOfChannel (const unsigned int &Sequencer, const unsigned int &Address, uint8_t channel, double Power)
Sets the phase of a multi channel DDS (for now the AD9958).
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF Wait_ms (double time_in_ms)
Wait for a given time in ms.
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF GetTime_ms (double &time_in_ms)
Get the current time in the currently assembled sequence ms.
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF GetTimeOfSequencer_ms (const unsigned int &Sequencer, double &time_in_ms)
Get the current time of a specific sequencer in the currently assembled sequence ms.
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF GetTimeDebtOfSequencer_ms (const unsigned int &Sequencer, double &time_debt_in_ms)
Get the time debtof a specific sequencer in the currently assembled sequence ms.
bool CLA_AddDeviceAD9854FromJSON (const json &device_json)

API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF AddDeviceAD9854 (unsigned int sequencer, unsigned int address, unsigned int version, double externalClockFrequency, uint8_t PLLReferenceMultiplier, unsigned int frequencyMultiplier)
Add a AD9854 device to the sequencer.
bool CLA_AddDeviceAD9858FromJSON (const json &device_json)
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF AddDeviceAD9858 (unsigned int sequencer, unsigned int address, double externalClockFrequency, unsigned int frequencyMultiplier)
Add a AD9858 device to the sequencer.
bool CLA_AddDeviceDigitalOutFromJSON (const json &device_json)
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF AddDeviceDigitalOut (unsigned int sequencer, unsigned int address, unsigned int numberChannels)
Add a digital output device to the sequencer.
bool CLA_AddDeviceAnalogIn12bitFromJSON (const json &device_json)
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF AddDeviceAnalogIn12bit (unsigned int sequencer, unsigned int chipSelect, bool signedValue, double minVoltage, double maxVoltage)
Add a 12 bit analog input device to the sequencer.
bool CLA_AddDeviceAnalogOut16bitFromJSON (const json &device_json)
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF AddDeviceAnalogOut16bit (unsigned int sequencer, unsigned int startAddress, unsigned int numberChannels, bool signedValue, double minVoltage, double maxVoltage)
Add a 16 bit analog output device to the sequencer.
bool CLA_AddDeviceSequencerFromJSON (const json &device_json)

API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF AddDeviceSequencer (unsigned int id, const char *type, const char *ip, unsigned int port, bool master, unsigned int startDelay, double clockFrequency, unsigned long FPGAClockToBusClockRatio, bool useExternalClock, bool useStrobeGenerator, bool connect)
Add a device sequencer to the list.
bool CLA_LoadFromJSON (const json &config)
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF LoadFromJSONFile (const const char *filename)
Load a configuration from a JSON file.
CDeviceSequencer * SequencerList [MaxSequencers] = {}
CDeviceSequencer * ShortSequencerList [MaxSequencers] = {}
CDeviceSequencer * MasterSequencer = nullptr
unsigned int NrSequencers = 0
unsigned long PCBufferSize_in_bytes = 0
std::string ConfigurationName = ""
double LineFrequency = 0
std::string LastError [MaxLastError] = {}
int LastErrorIndex = 0
bool ErrorListWrapAround = false
bool NewErrorOccured = false

para.computeroutput: #define _AFXDLL
#define API_LOCK_GUARD
#define API_UNLOCK
#define API_UNLOCK_RETURN_ERROR( success, error_message)
#define CATCH_MFC_EX_E ;
#define CATCH_MFC_EX_S ;
#define GET_CONFIG_VALUE( key, default_val)
#define GET_VALUE( key, default_val)

section.title: LOAD_CONFIG_VALUE

para.computeroutput: #define LOAD_CONFIG_VALUE( target, key, default_val)

section.programlisting: if (config.contains(key)) target = config[key]; else target = default_val;

section.title: LOAD_VALUE

para.computeroutput: #define LOAD_VALUE( target, key, default_val)

section.programlisting: if (device_json.contains(key)) target = device_json[key]; else target = default_val;

para.computeroutput: #define RETURN_ERROR( success, error_message)
using json = nlohmann::json

API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF AddDeviceAD9854 (unsigned int sequencer, unsigned int address, unsigned int version, double externalClockFrequency, uint8_t PLLReferenceMultiplier, unsigned int frequencyMultiplier)

para.para: Add a AD9854 device to the sequencer.

entry.para: the sequencer to use.
the address of the device to add.
the version of the device to add.
the external clock frequency of the device to add.
the PLL reference multiplier of the device to add.
the frequency multiplier of the device to add.

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF AddDeviceAD9858 (unsigned int sequencer, unsigned int address, double externalClockFrequency, unsigned int frequencyMultiplier)

para.para: Add a AD9858 device to the sequencer.

entry.para: the sequencer to use.
the address of the device to add.
the external clock frequency of the device to add.
the frequency multiplier of the device to add.

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF AddDeviceAnalogIn12bit (unsigned int sequencer, unsigned int chipSelect, bool signedValue, double minVoltage, double maxVoltage)

para.para: Add a 12 bit analog input device to the sequencer.

entry.para: the sequencer to use.
the chip select of the device to add.
true if the device is signed, false if it is unsigned.
the minimum voltage of the device to add.
the maximum voltage of the device to add.

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF AddDeviceAnalogOut16bit (unsigned int sequencer, unsigned int startAddress, unsigned int numberChannels, bool signedValue, double minVoltage, double maxVoltage)

para.para: Add a 16 bit analog output device to the sequencer.

entry.para: the sequencer to use.
the start address of the device to add.
the number of channels of the device to add.
true if the device is signed, false if it is unsigned.
the minimum voltage of the device to add.
the maximum voltage of the device to add.

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF AddDeviceDigitalOut (unsigned int sequencer, unsigned int address, unsigned int numberChannels)

para.para: Add a digital output device to the sequencer.

entry.para: the sequencer to use.
the address of the device to add.
the number of channels of the device to add.

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF AddDeviceSequencer (unsigned int id, const char * type, const char * ip, unsigned int port, bool master, unsigned int startDelay, double clockFrequency, unsigned long FPGAClockToBusClockRatio, bool useExternalClock, bool useStrobeGenerator, bool connect)

para.para: Add a device sequencer to the list.

entry.para: the id of the device sequencer to add (this is the number that all other commands are using when sending data to a device on this sequencer).
the type of the device sequencer to add.
the ip address of the device sequencer to add.
the port of the device sequencer to add.
true if the device sequencer is a master, false if it is a slave.
the start delay of the device sequencer to add.
the clock frequency of the device sequencer to add.
the FPGA clock to bus clock ratio of the device sequencer to add.
true if the device sequencer should use an external clock, false if it should use the internal clock.
true if the device sequencer should use a strobe generator, false if it should not.
true if the device sequencer should connect to the device, false if it should not.

para.computeroutput: ERROR_CODE_TYPE AddErrorMessage (const std::string & error_message)
bool CLA_AddDeviceAD9854FromJSON (const json & device_json)
bool CLA_AddDeviceAD9858FromJSON (const json & device_json)
bool CLA_AddDeviceAnalogIn12bitFromJSON (const json & device_json)
bool CLA_AddDeviceAnalogOut16bitFromJSON (const json & device_json)
bool CLA_AddDeviceDigitalOutFromJSON (const json & device_json)
bool CLA_AddDeviceSequencerFromJSON (const json & device_json)
bool CLA_InitializeMFC (bool InitializeAfx, bool InitializeAfxSocket)
bool CLA_LoadFromJSON (const json & config)
API_EXPORT void CLA_FNDEF Cleanup ( )

para.para: This function must be called when you are finished using the API. The class wrapped version of this API calls this function in its destructor.

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT void CLA_FNDEF Configure (bool _DisplayErrors)

para.para: Configures if the ControlAPI should display error messages.

entry.para: true to display error messages, false to suppress them.

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF Create (bool InitializeAfx, bool InitializeAfxSocket)

para.para: Initializes the ControlAPI. If you use a bare function C API, then this function must be called before using any other functions in the API. If you didn't load MFC yet (which is the case if you use Qt), then set.

entry.para: to true to initialize MFC core
to true to initialize MFC socket layer The class wrapped version of this API calls this function in its constructor.

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT bool CLA_FNDEF DidErrorOccur ( )

para.para: Check if an error has occurred since the last call to GetLastError.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: true if an error has occurred since the last call to GetLastError

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT void CLA_FNDEF ExecuteSequence ( )

para.para: Executes the sequence that was previously assembled.

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT const char *CLA_FNDEF GetLastError ( )

para.para: returns the last error messages

para.computeroutput: CDevice * GetParallelBusDevice (const unsigned int & Sequencer, const unsigned int & Address)[inline]
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF GetSequenceExecutionStatus (bool & running, unsigned long long & DataPointsWritten)

para.para: Get the current status of the sequence execution.

entry.para: returns true if the sequence is running, false if it is not.
returns number of data points that were already written out by the FPGA sequencer(s).

para.computeroutput: CDeviceSequencer * GetSequencer (const unsigned int & Sequencer)[inline]
CDeviceSequencer * GetSequencerBeforeInitialization (const unsigned int & Sequencer)[inline]
CDevice * GetSerialBusDevice (const unsigned int & Sequencer, const unsigned int & Address)[inline]
API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF GetTime_ms (double & time_in_ms)

para.para: Get the current time in the currently assembled sequence ms.

entry.para: the current time in ms.

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF GetTimeDebtOfSequencer_ms (const unsigned int & Sequencer, double & time_debt_in_ms)

para.para: Get the time debtof a specific sequencer in the currently assembled sequence ms.

entry.para: the sequencer to use.
the current time in ms.

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF GetTimeOfSequencer_ms (const unsigned int & Sequencer, double & time_in_ms)

para.para: Get the current time of a specific sequencer in the currently assembled sequence ms.

entry.para: the sequencer to use.
the current time in ms.

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF Initialize ( )

para.para: After Configuring the hardware, e.g. by loading a json configuration file, this function must be called to initialize the hardware.

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF IsReady ( )

para.para: Checks if the ControlAPI is ready to be used.

entry.para: true if the ControlAPI is ready to be used, false otherwise.

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF LoadFromJSONFile (const const char * filename)

para.para: Load a configuration from a JSON file.

entry.para: the name of the file to load the configuration from.

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SequencerAddMarker (const unsigned int & Sequencer, unsigned char marker)

para.para: Places a marker in the sequencer buffer. The FPGA SOM's CPU will see this marker and can react to it, e.g. write it to the USB-UART for debugging.

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SequencerIgnoreTCPIP (const unsigned int & Sequencer, bool OnOff)

para.para: Switches the sequencer to ignore TCP/IP commands. This is useful to prevent the sequencer from being interrupted by TCP/IP commands while executing a timing critical task, such as transferring input data from the FPGA BRAM to the DDR. This can be useful if lots of data is acquired at a high rate. Lot's of meaning: more than the size of the BRAM input buffer. How much that is depends how you configured the Vivado project that generates the FPGA sequencer firmware.

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SequencerStartAnalogInAcquisition (const unsigned int & Sequencer, const uint8_t & ChannelNumber, const uint32_t & NumberOfDataPoints, const double & DelayBetweenDataPoints_in_ms)

para.para: Start analog acquisition on the specified channel. This function places a commandto for the FPGA in the sequencer buffer. The analog in acquisition will start when this command is executed by the FPGA. Only one analog in acquisition can hapen at each moment. A new one can start right after the previous one is finished. The data will be returned at the end of a sequence when using CLA_WaitTillEndOfSequenceThenGetInputData.

entry.para: the sequencer to use.
the channel number to use.
the number of data points to acquire.
the delay between data points in ms.

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SequencerSwitchDebugLED (const unsigned int & Sequencer, unsigned int OnOff)

para.para: Switches the debug LED of the FPGA on or off.

entry.para: the sequencer to use.
true to switch on the LED, false to switch it off.

para.para: Writes a value to the input memory of the sequencer. This is useful to mark the start or end of a data acquisition, or to mark the type of experimental run in the full fledged version of the ControlAPI, which can cycle sequences automatically in the background. To execute this function, a command for the FPGA must be placed in the sequencer buffer.

entry.para: the sequencer to use.
the data to write to the input memory.
true to write the next address, false to write the address given.
the address to write to, if write_next_address is false.

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SequencerWriteSystemTimeToInputMemory (const unsigned int & Sequencer)

para.para: Writes the current FPGA clock ticks to the input memory of the sequencer.

entry.para: the sequencer to use.

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetAttenuation (const unsigned int & Sequencer, const unsigned int & Address, double Attenuation)

para.para: Sets the attenuation of a DDS (for now a AD9854 DDS).

entry.para: the sequencer to use.
the address of the device to set the attenuation for.
the attenuation to set in dB (-xxx ... 0).

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetClearACC1 (const unsigned int & Sequencer, const unsigned int & Address, bool OnOff)

para.para: Clears the ACC1 bit of a DDS (for now a AD9854 DDS).

entry.para: the sequencer to use.
the address of the device to set the ACC1 bit for.
true to set the ACC1 bit, false to clear it.

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetDigitalOutput (const unsigned int & Sequencer, const unsigned int & Address, uint8_t BitNr, bool OnOff)

para.para: Sets a digital output to high or low.

the bit number of the digital output to set.
true to set the output to high, false to set it to low.

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetFrequencyTuningWord (const unsigned int & Sequencer, const unsigned int & Address, uint64_t FrequencyTuningWord)

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetFSKBit (const unsigned int & Sequencer, const unsigned int & Address, bool OnOff)

entry.para: the sequencer to use.

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetFSKMode (const unsigned int & Sequencer, const unsigned int & Address, uint8_t mode)

para.para: Sets the FKS mode of a DDS (for now a AD9854 DDS).

entry.para: the sequencer to use.
the address of the device to set the FKS mode for.
the FKS mode to set (0..4).

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetModulationFrequency (const unsigned int & Sequencer, const unsigned int & Address, double Frequency)

para.para: Sets the modulation frequency of a DDS (for now a AD9854 DDS).

entry.para: the sequencer to use.
the address of the device to set the modulation frequency for.
the frequency to set.

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetPhaseOfChannel (const unsigned int & Sequencer, const unsigned int & Address, uint8_t channel, double Phase)

para.para: Sets the phase of a multi channel DDS (for now the AD9958).

entry.para: the sequencer to use.
the address of the device to set the phase for.
the channel number to set the phase for.
the phase to set.

the address of the device to set the power for.
the power to set in % (0...100).

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetPowerOfChannel (const unsigned int & Sequencer, const unsigned int & Address, uint8_t channel, double Power)

para.para: Sets the phase of a multi channel DDS (for now the AD9958).

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetRegister (const unsigned int & Sequencer, const unsigned int & Address, const unsigned int & SubAddress, const uint8_t * Data, const unsigned long & DataLength_in_bit, const uint8_t & StartBit = 0 )

para.para: This function sets a register for a device on the sequencer. What this means depends on the device type. This function gives us an easy way to add new functionality to a device without having to programm new DLL functions. SetRegister maps to the register map given in the device's datasheet. Note: this is not currently implemented in the API.

entry.para: the sequencer to use.
the address of the device to set the value for.
the subaddress of the device to set the value for.
the data to set.
the length of the data in bits.
the start bit of the data to set.

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetRegisterSerialDevice (const unsigned int & Sequencer, const unsigned int & Address, const unsigned int & SubAddress, const uint8_t * Data, const unsigned long & DataLength_in_bit, const uint8_t & StartBit = 0 )

para.para: As SetRegister, but for serial devices.

entry.para: the sequencer to use.
the address of the device to set the value for.
the subaddress of the device to set the value for.
the data to set.
the length of the data in bits.
the start bit of the data to set.

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetTimeDebtGuard_in_ms (const double & MaxTimeDebt_in_ms)

para.para: Sets a guard time. If sequencer commands make the time advance more than the guard time beyond what's allowed by Wait_ms, an error will be recorded (check with DidErrorOccur() if that happened) or thrown.

entry.para: maximum time debt in ms. If the sequencer commands make the time advance more than this, the sequencer will stop and wait for the next command.

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetTriangleBit (const unsigned int & Sequencer, const unsigned int & Address, bool OnOff)

para.para: Sets the triangle bit of a DDS (for now a AD9854 DDS).

entry.para: the sequencer to use.
the address of the device to set the triangle bit for.
true to set the triangle bit, false to clear it.

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetValue (const unsigned int & Sequencer, const unsigned int & Address, const unsigned int & SubAddress, const uint8_t * Data, const unsigned long & DataLength_in_bit, const uint8_t & StartBit = 0 )

para.para: This function sets a value for a device on the sequencer. What this means depends on the device type. This function gives us an easy way to add new functionality to a device without having to programm new DLL functions. In contrast to SetRegister, SetValue can execute more complex operations, such as calculating a DDS frequency tuning word from the given frequency and then programming that. There can be several SetValue functions for the same SetRegister function. There can be SetValue functions that set some parameter, or that trigger some action, not even necessarily related to the registers of the device.

entry.para: the sequencer to use.
the address of the device to set the value for.
the subaddress of the device to set the value for.
the data to set.
the length of the data in bits.
the start bit of the data to set.

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetValueSerialDevice (const unsigned int & Sequencer, const unsigned int & Address, const unsigned int & SubAddress, const uint8_t * Data, const unsigned long & DataLength_in_bit, const uint8_t & StartBit = 0 )

para.para: As SetValue, but for serial devices.

entry.para: the sequencer to use.
the address of the device to set the value for.
the subaddress of the device to set the value for.
the data to set.
the length of the data in bits.
the start bit of the data to set.

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF SetVoltage (const unsigned int & Sequencer, const unsigned int & Address, double Voltage)

para.para: Sets the voltage of an analog output device.

entry.para: the sequencer to use.
the address of the device to set the voltage for.
the voltage to set.

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT void CLA_FNDEF StartAssemblingSequence ( )

para.para: Starts assembling a sequence. Clears any previous sequence. Must be called before adding commands to the sequence.

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT void CLA_FNDEF SwitchDebugMode (bool OnOff, const char * FileName)

para.para: Switches Debug mode on. In Debug mode, the sequence of each FPGA sequencer is written to a human readable ASCII file before being sent to the FPGA. In addition, the FPGA sequencers display more information on their USB-UART port, being slowed down a bit by that.

entry.para: true to switch on debug mode, false to switch it off.
the name of the file to write the debug information to without filename extension.

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF Wait_ms (double time_in_ms)

para.para: Wait for a given time in ms.

entry.para: the time to wait in ms.

para.computeroutput: API_EXPORT ERROR_CODE_TYPE CLA_FNDEF WaitTillEndOfSequenceThenGetInputData (uint8_t *& buffer, unsigned long & buffer_length, unsigned long & EndTimeOfCycle, double timeout_in_s)

para.para: Waits until the sequence is finished, then gets the input data from the FPGA sequencer.

entry.para: pointer to the input data buffer. Don't delete this buffer, it is managed by the API.
length of the input data buffer in bytes.
returns the end time of the cycle in ms.
timeout in seconds. If the sequence is not finished within this time, the function returns false or throws an exception (depending on mode selected mode when compiling API).

para.computeroutput: std::string ConfigurationName = ""
bool ErrorListWrapAround = false
std::string LastError[MaxLastError] = {}
int LastErrorIndex = 0
double LineFrequency = 0
CDeviceSequencer* MasterSequencer = nullptr
bool NewErrorOccured = false
unsigned int NrSequencers = 0
unsigned long PCBufferSize_in_bytes = 0
CDeviceSequencer* SequencerList[MaxSequencers] = {}
CDeviceSequencer* ShortSequencerList[MaxSequencers] = {}
